CustomField.inlineHelpText: Behaviour towards unfamiliar person/handler - bring the dog to an area with enrichment options, if there is a safe outdoor area adjacent, the door can be left open. Drop the leash or unleash the dog if it is safe to do so. If there are concerns about safety, one person should keep hold of the leash OR allow the leash to trail or consider a longline. After there are signs of relaxation, call the dog in a friendly voice.
CustomField.label: Unfamiliar People - Behaviour

value.fullName: Relaxed: body language soft/loose, approaches, if excitable can recover
value.label: Relaxed: body language soft/loose, approaches, if excitable can recover

value.fullName: Appeasing: low body posture, may tail tuck/fast wag, lean, jump, sniff, lick, displacement
value.label: Appeasing: low body posture, may tail tuck/fast wag, lean, jump, sniff, lick, displacement

value.fullName: Anxious/fearful: avoids touch, may be vocal but retreats, tail tucked/still
value.label: Anxious/fearful: avoids touch, may be vocal but retreats, tail tucked/still

value.fullName: Overstimulated: high arousal/intensity, may jump with force/at height grab, intense sniffing
value.label: Overstimulated: high arousal/intensity, may jump with force/at height grab, intense sniffing

value.fullName: Repulsion/conflict: motivation increase distance, tense body/face, tail stiff, may hard stare, freeze, teeth-bare/vocalise
value.label: Repulsion/conflict: motivation increase distance, tense body/face, tail stiff, may hard stare, freeze, teeth-bare/vocalise

value.fullName: Severe fear: retreats/hides, may approach retreat, whale eye, tail tuck, high displacement, repetitive, vocal
value.label: Severe fear: retreats/hides, may approach retreat, whale eye, tail tuck, high displacement, repetitive, vocal
